results.title: Testing hearing in the pre-school child
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”
Demonstrates a series of hearing test procedures designed by Dr Mary Sheridan for use with children from six months to six years.

results.title: Children's emotions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child development series”.
Correlated with the book “Child development” by Elizabeth B. Hurlock, Ph. D., this film discusses the major emotions of childhood; curiosity, fear, anger, jealousy and joy. Children’s emotions are intense, frequent, but of short duration, and result in a number of behaviour responses.

results.title: Principles of development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Outlines the process of child development from early infancy. Defines principles of development and considers variables which make each child different.

results.title: Children's play
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Play is a dynamic factor in a child’s development as well as a requirement for good health. This film points out the changing form of children’s recreations, portraying play at each age level. The film demonstrates the important contributions parents can and should make to give their children the best possible chance for healthy play.

results.title: Child care and development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
The film gives overall consideration to the habits of daily physical care that ensure a happy, healthy child. Correct attitudes and procedures toward establishing good habits of eating, sleeping, and bathing are covered. Stresses the elements of good diet. The question of proper clothing - warm and light for the infant, sturdy and functional for the toddler - is explored. Raises the important consideration of suitable and becoming clothing as exerting considerable psychological influence on personality development. The importance of outdoor exercise is stressed. The film shows the importance of the attitudes of both parents and children towards good routines of daily living.

results.title: Clash (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child Care and Development”.
Coming up to the age of two, children are really beginning to assert their independence and this can often lead to a clash of will with their parents. The film looks at a wide range of different incidents involving children of this age and viewers are asked to decide what they would do if they were the parents.

results.title: Kathy and Ian: three-year-olds
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child”.
By the age of three children become aware of themselves as unique. This happens through their continuing interaction with parents, siblings and friends. This film explores these relationships and the resulting development within the child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
